content.description: This is a great warm-up for the area, short and sweet. It is a different feel with face climbing instead of overhanging jugs. And the rock is covered in fossils. Although the bolts look run out, there is easy climbing between the bolts and good stances for clipping.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the short wall facing U1. There are three bolts which lead up to chains.

content.description:
A pretty cool route, and also quite steep! But lacking a bit in rock quality. In particular, at the lip of the roof, you must negotiate some large but sketchy jugs. The good news is there's one less after I ripped it off and whipped. Also a bit of a run between the 2nd-3rd bolts.

 The dihedral at the top is pretty sweet though. A fun climb.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain and metolius rap hanger
content.location: This is the route with the locker fixed on the second bolt. Right side of the roofs.

content.description: Climbs the right side of a thin fin. An ok warm up, but there are some slightly spooky flakes etc.
content.location: First bolted route coming up the canyon. On the right side of the formation pictured on the main page.

content.description: I thought this one was pretty great. Though I opted to stick the first bolt after breaking a few other holds on a different route. In fact, the rock quality on this route is very good. It still could be cleaned, but the holds are large and awesome. Takes a line up right through a small roof.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a chain and rap hanger
content.location:
Farther left, this takes the right line in a large shady dihedral. Perhaps 20-30 paces left of u2, which is just below/around the corner from u1.

 Another landmark is a steeper route to the left of this that goes out a roof at the first bolt, and has a grey threaded sling up on a ledge for the belayer.

content.description: Born Again (and again, and again) is perhaps the best pitch in the canyon to date and takes a proud line up a bulging and heavily featured panel of stone. It starts under a horizontal roof to the left of Happy Trails. Crank out the roof and sprint to the top.
content.protection: Bolts to bolted anchor below the bulge at the top.

content.description:
Kaibab limestone right across from the Vermillion Cliffs. Expect big holds with some choss, and the bolting is a little "roomy." My guess is there was not a ton of cleaning of these routes but they are still pretty fun. Quick easy approach and a nice camping scene. The canyon itself is quite beautiful.

 JJ dropped a comment on the N Kaibab main page with some more info.
